website_summaries.verdict: The Nike Air Zoom Terra Kiger 5 is a lightweight trail running shoe designed for neutral pronators. It is considered by most users as a successful update to the Terra Kiger line. Positive reviews were given to the shoe’s overall design, ride quality, and comfort. Though a few were also disappointed because it is expensive and some structural elements have issues. In summary, the Terra Kiger 5 is a functional trail shoe loved by the majority.
pros: According to most users, the Nike Air Zoom Terra Kiger 5 has great cushioning for short distance runs
This trail shoe feels lighter and faster than the older version, said a couple of users
Majority of the buyers were satisfied with how durable the Terra Kiger 5 is
Several runners said that the shoe is very comfortable
Many users noted that the traction of this running shoe is very reliable, especially on dry trail surfaces
The 5th version of the Nike Air Zoom Terra Kiger delivers great fit from the heel to the forefoot
A few lauded the casual look of the shoe
They said they received a lot of compliments while wearing it
cons: A couple of users mentioned that the heel collar is too high and stiff

customer_reviews.title: Best trail shoe I have tried
customer_reviews.text: Very solid shoe. Comfortable and very well made. Best trail shoe I have had. Good job Nike. Well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Bernardo J. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Best trail running shoes I have used
customer_reviews.text: Best trail running shoes I have used yet. Looking forward to the next version
customer_reviews.author: dsharm190

customer_reviews.title: Low mileage racer
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight durable about 50 miles on them now with no complaints
customer_reviews.author: Sr ShopAlot

customer_reviews.title: Tight around forefoot
customer_reviews.text: I have had previous versions of this shoe, but found these very tight around the forefoot.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sizing Issue
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe but very narrow at the toes. Had to send back and I wear 11.5 for all Nikes. Order a size up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Style and Comfort
customer_reviews.text: I like the comfort.....I use them for my workouts and running
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe! Very comfortable for walking and running! Durable, they handle the rough terrain of Afghanistan very well! Received many compliments on the style of the shoe! My supervisor ordered a pair!
customer_reviews.author: christopher thomas

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes, run small.
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are great, but I would buy 1/2 to 1 whole size larger than normal, they ride small.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Mosher

customer_reviews.title: Fit perfectly right out of box
customer_reviews.text: 98/100 satisfaction score. Only deducted 2 points because shoes seem to hold the funk more than other runners. I don’t have any hypothesis—just an observation. They got stinky, but they fit and run like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Fina

customer_reviews.title: Limited Padding
customer_reviews.text: Fit is good and traction is very good. Not much padding especially around the laces.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and traction on the trail
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and grip very when running on trails even in wet weather
customer_reviews.author: JOSH A.

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: These work perfectly during my trail runs. Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: john v kane

customer_reviews.title: Bad inserts
customer_reviews.text: Good shoe design, bad arch support/insert. Feels very flat. I'm going to try and use a cheap insert.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy these
customer_reviews.text: Ordering process was great. But. These are not comfortable to run in. Too hard on your feet and Achilles. And do not run on any smooth rocks as they do not have good grip, despite what you would think. Good looking but insubstantial trail running shoe
customer_reviews.author: Peter Dunlop

product_meta.title: Nike Men's Air Zoom Terra Kiger 5 Competition Running Shoes
product_meta.description: Featuring materials inspired by spacesuits and quilted stitching on the upper, it takes the largest Air unit to date and blends it with the futuristic look of the final frontier. Mesh on the upper keeps your feet cool
feature_bullets: Zoom Air unit in the heel gives responsive cushioning.
Nike React technology is a lightweight, durable foam that delivers a smooth, responsive ride.
Perforated mesh and synthetic upper drains water and optimizes breathability.
Sticky rubber pods on outsole delivers wet-surface traction.
Overlays surround the forefoot for enhanced durability.
